page.title: 03The Working Mens Club
page.content: The Working Men's Club in Nettlebed was built in 1913. There are 400 members who as well as various groups use it weekly. The bar used to be in the kitchens until 6 years ago when it was moved. There is a games room, bar, ballroom, small hall, kitchen room, bar, ballroom, small hall kitchen , mens cloakroom and ladies cloakroom.The events which take place are discos, whist drives, darts, bingo, wedding receptions, meetings, and rummage sales. Also at Christmas Nettlebed School sings carols. The clubs which use it are Football club, Royal British Legion, Royal Observer Club,Bowls Club, Cricket Club and the Womens Institute.The Fleming family had it built for the village who pay them a nominal rent.
